title: On the Need to Rethink Trust in AI Assistants for Software Development: A Critical Review
data:
S Baltes, T Speith, B Chiteri, S Mohsenimofidi- IEEE Transactions on, 2026
Trust is a fundamental concept in human decisionmaking and collaboration that has 
long been studied in philosophy and psychology. However, software engineering 
(SE) articles often use the term trust informally; providing an explicit definition or 
embedding results in established trust models is rare. In SE research on AI 
assistants, this practice culminates in equating trust with the likelihood of accepting 
generated content, which, in isolation, does not capture the full conceptual
